title: Bengaluru floods: All eyes on new State government and Chief Minister Siddaramaiah
selftext: Six months after it was drowned by a deluge, not much has changed in Bengaluru. Basements continue to be inundated, and major roads continue to overflow in India’s so-called Silicon Valley. The sudden deluge brought back traumatic memories for many in the city, and created new ones, claiming a young life.
comments: They can start by kicking out Tushar Giri Nath immediately, both for repeated shoddiness and pro-BJP partisanship.
BBMP needs cleaning along with the gutters.
